channel.title: Im so stuck
channel.description:
omg look at my annoying error lol:
[code] ======================== Type C For Compile ======================== Type any other to close Option:c client.java:72: ';' expected public boolean PlayerHandler.playersInPc = 0; ^ client.java:72: <identifier> expected public boolean PlayerHandler.playersInPc = 0; ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . . [/code]

item.title: Im so stuck
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“The cook from runescape, post:12, topic:280764”]I apologise for your incompetence, and will try to explain myself again. First of all, we need to distinguish what part of my post you are confused with because it consisted of two sections really. I’ll explain both.

The difference between an integer and a boolean

An integer is a whole number, between -2147483648 and 2147483647 depending on whether it’s signed or not. You can have different types of integers which hold larger or smaller values, eg tinyint and longint.

A boolean can either be true or false, you can also use 1 for true and 0 for false but it’s best to just stick with true & false to keep the difference clear.

What forums are for

The primary aim of these forums is to educate new developers who want to edit private servers so they don’t keep coming back with similar retarded questions. To meet this aim, the forums need smart people who give helpful responses which actually teach the original poster something new. Spoonfeeding works against this because it’s only a temporary fix for a problem, and giving the wrong information is even worse because they get confused and post even more retarded topics.

I hope my post was helpful sir,
The cook from runescape[/quote]

Yo dude, this is like the first HELPFUL thing i have learnt from these forums!

Cheers!!

Also, can you please help me with my issue?

http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,370893.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Im so stuck
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

I apologise for your incompetence, and will try to explain myself again. First of all, we need to distinguish what part of my post you are confused with because it consisted of two sections really. I’ll explain both.

The difference between an integer and a boolean

An integer is a whole number, between -2147483648 and 2147483647 depending on whether it’s signed or not. You can have different types of integers which hold larger or smaller values, eg tinyint and longint.

A boolean can either be true or false, you can also use 1 for true and 0 for false but it’s best to just stick with true & false to keep the difference clear.

What forums are for

The primary aim of these forums is to educate new developers who want to edit private servers so they don’t keep coming back with similar retarded questions. To meet this aim, the forums need smart people who give helpful responses which actually teach the original poster something new. Spoonfeeding works against this because it’s only a temporary fix for a problem, and giving the wrong information is even worse because they get confused and post even more retarded topics.

I hope my post was helpful sir,
The cook from runescape

Read full topic

@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“The cook from runescape, post:10, topic:280764”]Now I feel even less sorry for you. What do you mean you just “forgot” - you stated two clear differences between an Integer and a Boolean which were totally wrong.

These forums are supposed to be helping people by educating them but it’s no good if the “teachers” are people who don’t know what they’re on about.[/quote]

Well, if your the ‘teacher’ please explain to me what the hell youe going on about… Im completely lost lol

item.description:

[quote=“Dalcian, post:1, topic:280975”]It’s boolean and your using int?

Idiot much?

= 0; - Int
== 0) { - Boolean

And your method is boolean. So do the math.[/quote]

You’re wrong.

Do you even know the difference between an Integer and Boolean value?

Do the math, as they say in America.
